thread.title: Styx drummer Todd Sucherman sued by fan after Atlanta concert
thread.title_full: Styx drummer Todd Sucherman sued by fan after Atlanta concert

author: Becca J. G. Godwin
title: Styx drummer Todd Sucherman sued by fan after Atlanta concert
text:
A Styx concert in Atlanta left a woman in the audience with physical scars, emotional anguish and “loss of enjoyment of life” after a drumstick struck her in the face, according to a lawsuit.
Lori Frederick is suing the band’s drummer and Texas resident Todd Sucherman , who the lawsuit says “negligently threw a drumstick into the audience during the performance” at Aaron’s Amphitheatre at Lakewood in June 2015.
Sucherman didn’t give “timely and proper warning to allow (Frederick) to fully protect herself from injury,” the suit alleges.
Lawsuit: Movers steal $3,750 worth of cabernet from metro Atlanta home Suit: Woman called ‘sugar pants,’ endured racial slurs at Fulton job As a result, it says Frederick lost the benefit of the concert tickets, her clothing was “rendered useless” by the blood from her injury and she was unable to register for the AJC Peachtree Road Race in July.
She seeks to recover damages including medical expenses and lost income.
Also named in the filing is Delaware-based TMB Productions, which “owned, operated or managed the band Styx in its musical performances” during the June 2015 incident.
Controversial group out in suit over Roswell cop’s Confederate flag Injured woman sues N. Fulton cryotherapy business for negligence The undated lawsuit, which appeared on a list of Georgia lawsuits this week, says Sucherman’s actions raise “the presumption of conscious indifference to actions,” and that he and TMB Productions “have been stubbornly litigious, acted in bad faith.”
A Styx spokeswoman did not immediately provide comment Tuesday.
Frederick’s attorney, Michael Deming, was unavailable Tuesday afternoon.
Lori Frederick v. Todd Sucherman and TMB Productions by Becca Godwin on Scribd
